message_1: A student carried out a chemical reaction in the laboratory and obtained 12 grams of the product. However, the theoretical yield of the product was 15 grams. Calculate the percent yield of the product.
message_2:
To calculate the percent yield of the product, you can use the following formula:

Percent Yield = (Actual Yield / Theoretical Yield) x 100

In this case, the actual yield is 12 grams, and the theoretical yield is 15 grams. Plugging these values into the formula:

Percent Yield = (12 / 15) x 100

Percent Yield = 0.8 x 100

Percent Yield = 80%

So, the percent yield of the product is 80%.
